Talk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy>Strange to think that I can learn about
world affairs just by reading the paper...
Talk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Those magnificent geniuses at the <clr:0000>Lucky
Clover Gazette<clr:ffff>...
Talk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Seems like that big cold snap in <clr:0000>Hebra<clr:ffff>
is over. Maybe I ought to take a little field
trip to the <clr:0000>Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff>.
Talk04:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad>It started pouring so suddenly! You really
shouldn't be out in weather like this.

For one thing, wet hands can really mess
up a good <clr:0000>newspaper<clr:ffff>.
Talk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:TalkPositive>Don't get in my way today! I'm ready for
some fun!

The rain's stopped, and I want to get
outside to read my newspaper.

<sp:3:0:2:0001>When I read in a quiet place with a breeze
blowing, I can get a better sense of the
world. That's just how it works for me.
